mistral.reason: Madame Butterfly (1915 film) was not written by John Luther Long, but based on his short story "Madame Butterfly". The original work of literature was adapted for the stage as a play by David Belasco and later used by Giacomo Puccini as the basis for his opera.

gemma2.reason: It states the 1915 film was written by John Luther Long, but the provided text clearly lists David Belasco and John Luther Long as the playwrights for the source material, not the film. Additionally, the credits for the 1915 film list Sidney Olcott and Marion Gering as directors.
